Feel: Emphasis on a key phrase; intentional cut-in like a second angle
How to use (rules): On a jump cut, punch in ~8–18% and HOLD for the emphasized phrase; cut back when idea changes.

Feel: Fast snap-in for comedy/drama; ‘LOOK AT THIS’ moment
How to use (rules): Zoom in over 4–10 frames; add tiny overshoot (1–2%) then settle; HOLD on landing.

Best for: Segment transitions, montage beats, vlog pacing
How to use (rules): Add fast directional movement + blur; cut on peak motion; land sharp and optionally stay zoomed.
Typical settings: Directional blur peak at cut; duration 8–16 frames

How to use (rules): Slowly increase scale over 2–6s; ease in/out; works great with other motion (hands/b‑roll layer).

Feel: Documentary clarity; makes stills/screenshots feel alive
How to use (rules): Pan + zoom slowly; end on the detail you want remembered; HOLD at end.

Feel: Hyper but clean if used sparingly; high-energy cut
How to use (rules): Add radial/zoom blur that peaks mid-transition; resolve sharp on landing; optionally stay zoomed.
Typical settings: 12–20 frames; blur peaks at cut; ease

Best for: Travel, vlogs, topic changes, visual storytelling
How to use (rules): Zoom into a subject/object; cut to a new shot matching size/position; continue motion slightly then settle.
Typical settings: Match scale/center; 8–16 frame move into/out of cut

Best for: Reveals, stakes shifts, ‘uh oh’ moments (use sparingly)
How to use (rules): Move camera in/out while zooming opposite; in post, simulate with 3D/camera tricks.

Feel: Premium ‘3D’ movement from a still/layered frame
How to use (rules): Separate foreground/background; place in 3D space; push camera in; land on subject and HOLD.
Typical settings: Camera push 2–6s; subtle drift; depth separation

Feel: Modern shorts/reels energy; accentuates action beats
How to use (rules): Ramp speed (fast→slow or slow→fast) into a zoom/punch on the beat; settle back to normal.
Typical settings: Ramp 0.3–1.2s; sync to audio beat; optional blur
